column4: The specific purpose of performing ELISA. If not in the list, select Other and fill it in the next field.
The format of the assay used to capture and detect the analyte.
The specific molecule or protein being measured.
The title of the kit/biologicals used.
date or a rough date when the assay was performed
The biological context of the sample.
A category header for the sample information below.
A label to categorize the samples, such as "Control", "Treatment", "Disease", or "Healthy". or collection time points, etc.
Self-defined sample ID(s). Make sure it is the same when entering the sample metadata.
The species from which samples were derived.
A description of the physical nature of the sample.
Biological condition of the sample source.
The material and format of the plate used for the assay.
If using a custom assay, please specifiy the primary antibody and vendor.
Please specify the final signal generation system.
A list of the checks performed to ensure the data is reliable.
Link or DOI of the literature that is relevant to this experiment.
(For metadata provider) Local path, folder name where data are store, private repository, etc. (For sharing) path in shared folder, link to public repository, etc.
Notes about this experiment. Either for fellow researchers or to the metadata provider in the future.

column3: Quantification of Angiogenic and/or Lymphangiogenic Factors
